partitionKey.description: Name of the partition key. The default type is string. You can specify the key type by specifying the key name followed by the type identifier split with colon (e.g. _id:N or _id:S). Avaliable types S - for String type, N - Number type and B - Binary type. WARNING: changing the key name or the type would replace the table with a new table.

sortKey.description: Name of the sort key. The default type is string. You can specify the key type by specifying the key name followed by the type identifier split with colon (e.g. _date:N or date:S). Avaliable types S - for String type, N - Number type and B - Binary type. WARNING: changing the key name or the type would replace the table with a new table.

gsiPartitionKey.description: Global Secondary Index primary key. The default type is string. You can specify the key type by specifying the key name followed by the type identifier split with colon (e.g. _id:N or _id:S). Avaliable types S - for String type, N - Number type and B - Binary type.

gsiSortKey.description: Global Secondary Index sort key. The default type is string. You can specify the key type by specifying the key name followed by the type identifier split with colon (e.g. _date:N or date:S). Avaliable types S - for String type, N - Number type and B - Binary type.

gsiProjectionType.description: The set of attributes that are projected into the GSI

TTLAttributeName.description: The name of the TTL attribute used to store the expiration time for items in the table.

readCapacityUnits.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

writeCapacityUnits.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

backupScheduleExpression.description: A CRON expression (in UTC timezone) specifying when AWS Backup initiates a backup job. If not provided, the backup will be disabled. E.g. cron(0 12 * * ? *)

billingMode.description: Specify how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity.

deletionProtectionEnabled.description: Determines if a table is protected from deletion. When enabled, the table cannot be deleted by any user or process.
